## Possible Hands


Playing three 9s (Spades, Hearts, Diamonds) creates a three of a kind with 30 base chips and 3x mult. Each 9 triggers Odd Todd for +31 chips, giving 93 bonus chips from that joker alone. The three cards themselves contribute 27 chips, totaling 150 chips from this hand.

Positioning the 9 of Spades first activates Hanging Chad twice more. Each additional trigger grants 9 chips plus the 31 from Odd Todd, so 40 chips per trigger. Two extra triggers add 80 chips beyond the initial hand. For multiplier, Swashbuckler adds 11 to the base 3, Ancient Joker multiplies by 1.5 three times (3.375x total), and the Steel Card in hand provides another 1.5x, resulting in 71.0625x mult. The final score multiplies 230 chips by this multiplier.

The calculation yields roughly 16,344 chips—still insufficient. I need to explore other hand combinations. A flush using Hearts and Diamonds offers more potential, since I can form a 7-card suit combination through Smeared Joker. The strongest flush would prioritize odd-valued cards in earlier positions to maximize Odd Todd's effect.

Starting with 9 of Hearts in the first position and assuming two retriggered plays, the base chips total 232, with each additional trigger contributing 40 chips. This brings the total to 312 chips—still far below what's needed.

For the multiplier, the base of 8 increases to 19 with Swashbuckler, then multiplies by 1.5 from the Steel Card held in hand, giving 28.5 total. That yields 312 × 28.5 = 8,892 chips, which remains insufficient. I realize the Steel Card's multiplier only activates when kept in hand rather than played, so I should explore keeping it unplayed while adjusting the card selection for the play itself.

The 9 of Spades offers strong synergy—it triggers Ancient Joker's X1.5 multiplier and Odd Todd's +31 bonus, with Hanging Chad retriggering it twice more. However, including it conflicts with building a flush since I only have one Spades card available. A Hearts/Diamonds flush seems more viable, but adding the 9 of Spades would break that pattern.

Let me focus on what actually works: a Three of a Kind with the three 9s positioned strategically. The 9 of Spades in position 1 gets retriggered by Hanging Chad, and combined with the Steel 8 of Hearts for the X1.5 multiplier, this could generate the chips I need across the remaining hands. Plated Joker in hand) = 14 × 3.375 × 1.5 = 71.0625

Total score: 230 × 71.0625 = 16,344.375 chips

That's still short of the 28,117 target. I should consider discarding again to hunt for more high-value cards, particularly Spades or Clubs that would trigger Ancient Joker multiple times and push the score higher.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
